A Brief History:
Inspired by a spirit writing device, Albert C. Carter came up with the idea of a Magic 8 Ball toy. Carter tried to bring the device to stock in a toy store in the 1940s, getting the attention of a store owner named Max Levinson. Levinson was aided by his brother-in-law Abe Bookman. Bookman patented the spherical device. Before the patent was granted, Carter had passed away. The patent was then granted in 1948 where Bookman kept making improvements. The Magic 8 Ball was then presented in stores, first as a paper weight, and now as an old-time toy for children (Wikipedia).
